pkgmetadata.longdescription: Vectors are represented by lists with type-encoded lengths. The constructor is @:.@, which acts like a cons both at the value and type levels, with @()@ taking the place of nil. So @x:.y:.z:.()@ is a 3d vector. The library provides a set of common list-like functions (map, fold, etc) for working with vectors. Built up from these functions are a small but useful set of linear algebra operations: matrix multiplication, determinants, solving linear systems, inverting matrices.
